CatDescriptText: Frank Madison, porter, Fifth Ward, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 14, 1961, pg. B1 with question: "At what age should young folks be allowed to have unchaperoned parties?" answer reads: "From 19 on, because at that age they know what they want, and what they are going to do and they know the difference between right and wrong."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Frank Madison wearing fedora, moustache, soul patch, polyester shirt, and light colored suit jacket, standing in front of building
